00063 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00064 /* The pixel format for the pbuffer is controlled by the mode string passed
00065 * into the PBuffer constructor. This string can have the following attributes:
00066 *
00067 * To specify the pixel format, use the following syntax.
00068 *   <channels>=<bits>
00069 * <channels> must match one of the following.
00070 *
00071 * r            - r pixel format (for float buffer).
00072 * rg           - rg pixel format (for float buffer).
00073 * rgb          - rgb pixel format. 8 bit or 16/32 bit in float buffer mode
00074 * rgba         - same as "rgb alpha" string
00075 *
00076 * <bits> can either be a scalar--meaning the same bit depth for each
00077 * channel-- or a 2-, 3-, 4-component vector matching the specified number of
00078 * channels. Vector components should be comma separated. An optional 'f'
00079 * suffix on the bit depth specifies float components.  In this case <bits>
00080 * must be either "32f" or "16f".  If <bits> is empty, the default 8 bits per
00081 * channel will be used.
00082 *   r=32f
00083 *   rg=16f
00084 *   rgb=8
00085 *   rgb=5,6,5
00086 *
00087 * The following other attributes are supported.
00088 *
00089 * depth=n      - must have n-bit depth buffer, omit n for default (24 bits)
00090 * stencil=n    - must have n-bit stencil buffer, omit n for default (8 bits)
00091 * samples=n    - must support n-sample antialiasing (n can be 2 or 4)
00092 * aux=n        - must have n AUX buffers
00093 * doublebuffer - must support double buffered rendering
00094 *
00095 * tex2D
00096 * texRECT
00097 * texCUBE  - must support binding pbuffer as texture to specified target
00098 *          - binding the depth buffer is also supported by specifying
00099 * depthTex2D
00100 * depthTexRECT
00101 * depthTexCUBE
00102 *          - Both depth and color texture binding, may be specified, but
00103 *            the targets must match!
00104 *            For example: "tex2D depthTex2D" or "texRECT depthTexRECT"
00105 *
00106 * rtt
00107 * ctt      - These mutually exclusive options specify the update method used
00108 *            for render textures that support texture binding. "rtt"
00109 *            indicates that render to texture will be used to update the
00110 *            texture. "ctt" indicates that copy to texture will be used
00111 *            (i.e. glCopyTexSubImage2D()). "rtt" is the default if neither is
00112 *            specified, and one of the "tex*" options above is.
00113 *
00114 *
00115 *---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00116 *
00117 * USAGE NOTES:
00118 *
00119 * * Texture Parameters:
00120 *   The default texture wrap mode is GL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE for all textures, and
00121 *   the default texture filtering modes (min and mag) are GL_NEAREST.
00122 *   To change these parameters, simply bind the SpStreamBuffer (using the
00123 *   bind() method), and set them the way you would for any GL texture object.
00124 *   The same goes for depth textures.
00125 *
00126 * * Enabling Mipmapping:
00127 *   This is similar to the texture parameters above.  When "rtt" is specified
00128 *   in the mode string, "mipmap" must also be specified in order to enable
00129 *   a mipmapped pbuffer.  Then, the mipmaps must be created by enabling the
00130 *   GL_SGIS_GENERATE_MIPMAP texture parameter in the same way as above, and
00131 *   the min filter mode must be set to a mipmap filter mode, as with any
00132 *   mipmapped texture object.
00133 *
00134 * * Enabling Anisotropic Filtering
00135 *   As with the texture parameters above, except as in the following code:
00136 *   glGetFloatv(GL_MAX_TEXTURE_MAX_ANISOTROPY_EXT, max);
00137 *   glTexParameterf(target, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_ANISOTROPY_EXT, <value < max>);
00138 */
00139 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00141 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00142 class SpStreamBuffer
00143 {
00144 
00146 public:
00147 
00148     enum UpdateMode
00149     {
00150         RT_RENDER_TO_TEXTURE,
00151         RT_COPY_TO_TEXTURE
00152     };
00153 
00155 public:
00156 
00157     SpStreamBuffer(const char *strMode="rgb tex2D");
00158     ~SpStreamBuffer();
00159 
00161 public:
00162 
00166     bool initialize(
00167         int iWidth, int iHeight,
00168         bool bShareObjects=true,
00169         bool bCopyContext=false);
00170 
00171     // !Change the render texture format.
00172     bool reset(const char* acStrMode,...);
00173 
00174     // !Change the size of the render texture.
00175     bool resize(int iWidth, int iHeight);
00176 
00177     // !Copies the data stored in the buffer to the given location
00178     unsigned int copyBufferData(void *pvData, int iW=-1, int iH=-1){}
00179 
00180     // !Begin drawing to the texture. (i.e. use as "output" texture)
00181     bool enable();
00182 
00183     // !Ends drawing to 'current', begins drawing to this SpStreamBuffer
00184     bool enable(SpStreamBuffer* pkCurrent);
00185 
00186     // !End drawing to the texture.
00187     bool disable();
00188 
00189     // !Bind the texture to the active texture unit for use as an "input" texture
00190     void bind() const;
00191 
00192     // !Bind the depth texture to the active texture unit for use as an "input" texture
00193     void bindDepth() const;
00194 
00195     // !Associate the RTT texture with 'iBuffer' (default is WGL_FRONT_LEFT_ARB)
00196     bool bindBuffer( int iBuffer );
00197 
00198     // !Enables texture filtering for the texture target based on current state
00199     void enableTextureFiltering();
00200 
00202     inline void enableTextureTarget() const
00203     { if (m_bInitialized) glEnable(m_eTextureTarget); }
00204 
00206     inline void disableTextureTarget() const
00207     { if (m_bInitialized) glDisable(m_eTextureTarget); }
00208 
00210     inline unsigned int getTextureId() const
00211     { return m_uiTextureId; }
00212 
00214     inline unsigned int getDepthTextureId() const
00215     { return m_uiDepthTextureId; }
00216 
00218     inline unsigned int getTextureTarget() const
00219     { return m_eTextureTarget; }
00220 
00222     inline operator unsigned int() const
00223     {return m_uiTextureId;}
00224 
00226     inline int getWidth() const
00227     { return m_iWidth;  }
00228 
00230     inline int getHeight() const
00231     { return m_iHeight; }
00232 
00234     inline int getMaxS() const
00235     { return isRectangleTexture() ? m_iWidth : 1; }
00236 
00238     inline int getMaxT() const
00239     { return isRectangleTexture() ? m_iHeight : 1; }
00240 
00242     inline int getRedBits() const
00243     { return m_uiColorBits[0]; }
00244 
00246     inline int getGreenBits() const
00247     { return m_uiColorBits[1]; }
00248 
00250     inline int getBlueBits() const
00251     { return m_uiColorBits[2]; }
00252 
00254     inline int getAlphaBits() const
00255     { return m_uiColorBits[3]; }
00256 
00258     inline int getDepthBits() const
00259     { return m_uiDepthBits; }
00260 
00262     inline int getStencilBits() const
00263     { return m_uiStencilBits; }
00264 
00266     inline const SpString& getModeString() const // [DG]
00267     { return m_kModeString; }
00268 
00270     inline bool isInitialized() const
00271     { return m_bInitialized; }
00272 
00274     inline bool isTexture() const
00275     { return m_bIsTexture; }
00276 
00278     inline bool isDepthTexture() const
00279     { return m_bIsDepthTexture; }
00280 
00282     inline bool isFloatTexture() const
00283     { return m_bIsFloat; }
00284 
00286     inline bool isDoubleBuffered() const
00287     { return m_bIsDoubleBuffered; }
00288 
00290     inline bool isRectangleTexture() const
00291     { return m_bIsRectangle; }
00292 
00294     inline bool hasDepth() const
00295     { return (m_uiDepthBits > 0); }
00296 
00298     inline bool hasStencil() const
00299     { return (m_uiStencilBits > 0); }
00300 
00302     inline bool isMipMapped() const
00303     { return m_bIsMipMapped; }
00304 
00312     static bool isPowerOfTwo(int n)
00313     { return ((n&(n-1))==0); }
00314 
00316 protected:
00317 
00318     typedef std::pair<SpString, SpString> KeyVal;
00319     typedef std::vector<int> IntArray;
00320 
00322 protected:
00323 
00324     bool invalidate();
00325

00329         IntArray &rkPixelBufferAttribs
00330     );
00331 
00332     IntArray parseBitVector(SpString bitVector);
00333     KeyVal getKeyValuePair(SpString token);

00336     bool initializeTextures();

00339     bool releaseBoundBuffers();

00375 
00376 #ifdef _WIN32

00379     HPBUFFERARB  m_hPixelBuffer;   // Handle to a pbuffer.
00380

00383 #else

00389     GLXContext   m_hPreviousContext;
00390 #endif
00391 
00392     // Texture stuff
00393     GLenum       m_eTextureTarget;
00394     unsigned int m_uiTextureId;
00395     unsigned int m_uiDepthTextureId;
00396 
00397     unsigned short* m_ausPoorDepthTexture; // [Redge]
00398 
00399     IntArray    m_kPixelFormatAttribs;
00400     IntArray    m_kPixelBufferAttribs;
00401

00412 };
